Uses of Package
java.lang.invoke

  • Packages that use java.lang.invoke 
    Package Description
    java.lang.invoke
    The java.lang.invoke package contains dynamic language support provided directly by the Java core class libraries and virtual machine.
  • Classes in java.lang.invoke used by java.lang.invoke 
    Class and Description
    BoundMethodHandle
    The flavor of method handle which emulates an invoke instruction on a predetermined argument.
    BoundMethodHandle.SpeciesData
    Meta-data wrapper for concrete BMH classes.
    CallSite
    A CallSite is a holder for a variable MethodHandle, which is called its target.
    DirectMethodHandle
    The flavor of method handle which implements a constant reference to a class member.
    DirectMethodHandle.EnsureInitialized 
    DontInline
    Internal marker for some methods in the JSR 292 implementation.
    ForceInline
    Internal marker for some methods in the JSR 292 implementation.
    InvokerBytecodeGenerator.CpPatch 
    Invokers
    Construction and caching of often-used invokers.
    LambdaForm
    The symbolic, non-executable form of a method handle's invocation semantics.
    LambdaForm.Hidden
    Internal marker for LambdaForm interpreter frames.
    LambdaForm.Name 
    LambdaForm.NamedFunction 
    MemberName
    A MemberName is a compact symbolic datum which fully characterizes a method or field reference.
    MemberName.Factory
    A factory type for resolving member names with the help of the VM.
    MethodHandle
    A method handle is a typed, directly executable reference to an underlying method, constructor, field, or similar low-level operation, with optional transformations of arguments or return values.
    MethodHandle.PolymorphicSignature
    Internal marker interface which distinguishes (to the Java compiler) those methods which are signature polymorphic.
    MethodHandles.Lookup
    A lookup object is a factory for creating method handles, when the creation requires access checking.
    MethodType
    A method type represents the arguments and return type accepted and returned by a method handle, or the arguments and return type passed and expected by a method handle caller.
    MethodType.WeakInternSet
    Weak intern set based on implementation of the HashSet and WeakHashMap, with weak values.
    MethodType.WeakInternSet.Entry
    The entries in this hash table extend WeakReference, using its main ref field as the key.
    MethodTypeForm
    Shared information for a group of method types, which differ only by reference types, and therefore share a common erasure and wrapping.
    MutableCallSite
    A MutableCallSite is a CallSite whose target variable behaves like an ordinary field.
    SimpleMethodHandle
    A method handle whose behavior is determined only by its LambdaForm.
    SwitchPoint
    A SwitchPoint is an object which can publish state transitions to other threads.
    WrongMethodTypeException
    Thrown to indicate that code has attempted to call a method handle via the wrong method type.
